title: Air Force rocket cargo initiative marches forward despite questions about feasibility
summary: The U.S. Air Force is pressing forward with plans to demonstrate point-to-point rocket travel perhaps in a few years.

title: For the first time NASA has asked industry about private missions to Mars
summary: "I'm curious to see if this request brings many new players to the table."

title: Orbital Composites and Virtus Solis announce space-based solar power demonstration
summary: Silicon Valley startup Orbital Composites and Michigan-based Virtus Solis plan to conduct a 2027 space-based solar power demonstration.

title: POLARIS Spaceplanes Conduct First Rocket-Powered Roll Test
summary:
German startup POLARIS Spaceplanes has completed the first rocket-powered roll test of its MIRA demonstrator. MIRA is 4.25 metres long and is equipped with four kerosene-fed turbine engines and one of the company’s AS-1 LOX/kerosene linear aerospike engines, which is designed to produce 1kN of thrust. Testing of the vehicle under the power of its […]
The post POLARIS Spaceplanes Conduct First Rocket-Powered Roll Test appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: NASA workshop to examine options for Apophis asteroid mission
summary: NASA is hosting a workshop later this month to learn about options for low-cost missions to an asteroid that will make a close approach to the Earth in 2029, a move that has confused some scientists who believe a shelved smallsat mission can meet NASA’s needs.
